cities.name: Addis Ababa
cities.description: Addis Ababa is the capital city of Ethiopia and is home to various cultural and historical landmarks, as well as bustling markets and lively nightlife.

cities.name: Gondar
cities.description: Gondar is a historic city in Ethiopia, known for its well-preserved 17th-century castles and churches.

cities.name: Bahir Dar
cities.description: Bahir Dar is a city in northern Ethiopia, situated on the southern shore of Lake Tana, which is the source of the Blue Nile river.

cities.name: Axum
cities.description: Axum is an ancient city in northern Ethiopia, known for its rich history and cultural heritage. It was once the capital of the Axumite Kingdom and is now a UNESCO World Heritage site.
attractions: Church of Our Lady Mary of Zion
The Tomb of Kaleb and Gebre Meskel

cities.name: Lalibela
cities.description: Lalibela is a town in northern Ethiopia known for its rock-cut monolithic churches, which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The churches were carved out of the red volcanic rock in the 12th and 13th centuries, and are considered to be some of the finest examples of Ethiopian architecture and engineering.

cities.name: Harar
cities.description: Harar is a city in eastern Ethiopia, known for its ancient walled city, which has been designated a UNESCO World Heritage site.
attractions: Rimbaud's House - former home of French poet Arthur Rimbaud
Hyena feeding - experience feeding wild hyenas by hand
travel_means: By air - via Dire Dawa International Airport
By bus - from Addis Ababa or other major cities in Ethiopia
By car - self-drive or hire a driver

cities.name: Awasa/Hawassa
cities.description: Awasa/Hawassa is a city in southern Ethiopia, located on the shores of Lake Awasa. It is known for its natural beauty and cultural heritage.
attractions: Lake Awasa - scenic lake with boat rides and fishing
African Union Monument - tribute to African unity
Awasa Aquarium - home to various fish species found in Ethiopia's lakes and rivers
Senkele Wildlife Sanctuary - protected area for endangered animals such as the Swayne's hartebeest and the white-tailed rat
travel_means: By bus - from Addis Ababa or other major cities in Ethiopia
By car - self-drive or hire a driver

cities.name: Arba Minch
cities.description: Arba Minch is a city in southern Ethiopia, located at the foothills of the Gamo Highlands. It is known for its natural beauty and diverse cultural heritage.
attractions: Nechisar National Park - home to zebras, gazelles, crocodiles and over 300 bird species
Lake Chamo - scenic lake with boat rides and fishing
Dorze Village - cultural village known for its unique bamboo houses and traditional weaving
Arba Minch Textile Museum - museum showcasing the history and techniques of Ethiopian weaving
travel_means: By air - via Arba Minch Airport
By bus - from Addis Ababa or other major cities in Ethiopia
By car - self-drive or hire a driver
